meanings.definition: A typesetting machine used in printing.
meanings.sent1: The linotype was a revolutionary invention in the printing industry.
meanings.sent2: The linotype quickly and efficiently produced newspapers in the early 20th century.
meanings.sent3: When the linotype broke down, the newspaper office was in chaos.
meanings.sent4: The linotype hummed like a busy bee, churning out words for the newspaper.
meanings.sent5: The clanking sound of the linotype was music to the ears of the typesetter.

meanings.definition: To set type using a linotype machine.
meanings.sent1: The typesetter would linotype the text for the next day's edition.
meanings.sent2: She linotyped the article with precision and speed.
meanings.sent3: He linotyped so fast that his fingers danced across the keys.
meanings.sent4: Linotyping the document felt like painting with words.
meanings.sent5: The linotyping process transformed the blank page into a printed masterpiece.
